meanings.definition: The action of discouraging an action or event through fear of consequences.
meanings.sent1: The loud alarm served as deterrence against burglars.
meanings.sent2: The police presence in the neighborhood acted as deterrence to crime.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog was a deterrence to the mailman, making him run away.
meanings.sent4: The high fence around the house was a deterrence to unwanted visitors.
meanings.sent5: The security guard's stern look was a powerful deterrence to troublemakers.

meanings.definition: The act of preventing something from happening.
meanings.sent1: The vaccine was a deterrence against the spread of the disease.
meanings.sent2: The early curfew was a deterrence to late-night parties.
meanings.sent3: The locked gate was a deterrence to the curious cat, keeping it out of the garden.
meanings.sent4: The bright light was a deterrence to moths, keeping them away from the porch.
meanings.sent5: The warning sign was a clear deterrence to trespassers, keeping them off the property.
